text: Bernie Sanders Comments on Balenciaga’s Fashion Homage February 6, 2017 1:07 AM by Steff Yotka “I want to ask you, as a closing question, about something that is admittedly rather frivolous," began CNN anchor Jake Tapper in an interview with Senator Bernie Sanders. That frivolous question had to do with Balenciaga’s Fall 2017 menswear show in Paris which featured a number of pieces printed with a riff on Sanders’s 2016 campaign logo. Demna Gvasalia’s runway looks read Balenciaga in Sanders’s signature font with three wavy lines underneath; to the fashion set the inspiration was obvious. Sanders himself didn’t comment on whether he liked the pieces or not; instead he went the self-deprecating route. “Of my many attributes, being a great dresser or a fashion maven is not one of them,” he demurred, laughing. Don’t slight yourself, Bernie; if we know anything, fashion folks will be lining up to buy those Balenciaga pieces in droves. In This Story: Politics , Balenciaga Recommended For You
